com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapGesture.OnGestureListener.OnGestureListenerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapGesture.OnGestureListener.OnGestureListenerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapGesture.OnGestureListener
    Enclosing interface:
    MapGesture.OnGestureListener

    public abstract static class MapGesture.OnGestureListener.OnGestureListenerAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements MapGesture.OnGestureListener
    Default implementation for the OnGestureListener interface. Users may use this abstract class and overload specific methods to have a smaller code footprint.
    See Also:
    MapGesture.OnGestureListener

      • onMapObjectsSelected

        public boolean onMapObjectsSelected(java.util.List<ViewObject> objects)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that at least one ViewObject has been selected as a result of a user tapping on the map.

        If the user tapping on the map results in ViewObject selection (there are selectable objects located at the tap point), this callback will be made after MapGesture.OnGestureListener.onTapEvent(PointF), if and only if, false is returned for that callback.

        Note: If the user taps on an Android view in a MapOverlay, this method is triggered, but objects will be populated with a list of substitute MapMarker objects. These markers have the same geocoordinates as the map overlays. To avoid this behavior and these substitute markers, do not use this callback method. Instead, use Android gesture handling on the MapOverlay subclass.

        Specified by:
        onMapObjectsSelected in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        objects - A list of selected ViewObject objects
        Returns:
        true if consumed, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Map.getSelectedObjectsNearby(PointF)
        Override:

      • onTapEvent

        public boolean onTapEvent(android.graphics.PointF p)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has performed a single-tap gesture on a map.

        If true is returned from this callback, no MapGesture.OnGestureListener.onMapObjectsSelected(List) callback will be made to any gesture subscribers even if any objects are found at the screen point.

        Specified by:
        onTapEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        p - A PointF representing the on-screen point of the single-tap gesture
        Returns:
        true if consumed (which prevents the default pan-to-here behavior), false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Map.getSelectedObjectsNearby(PointF)
        Override:

      • onDoubleTapEvent

        public boolean onDoubleTapEvent(android.graphics.PointF p)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener

        Specified by:
        onDoubleTapEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        p - A PointF representing the on-screen point of the double-tap gesture
        Returns:
        True if consumed (which prevents the default map zoom-in behavior), false otherwise
        Override:

      • onPinchLocked

        public void onPinchLocked()
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has pinched enough to be recognized as the two-finger zoom gesture. This callback will only occur if MapGesture is set to exclusive mode from MapGesture.setRotateEnabled(boolean)
        Specified by:
        onPinchLocked in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        See Also:
        MapGesture.setRotateEnabled(boolean)
        Override:

      • onPinchZoomEvent

        public boolean onPinchZoomEvent(float scaleFactor,
                                android.graphics.PointF p)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has performed a pinch-to-zoom gesture on a map.
        Specified by:
        onPinchZoomEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - A scale factor relative to the points of the two simultaneous touches at separate screen coordinates
        p - A PointF representing the on-screen point of the pinch gesture
        Returns:
        True if consumed (which prevents the default map zoom-in or zoom-out behavior), false otherwise
        Override:

      • onRotateLocked

        public void onRotateLocked()
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has rotated enough to be recognized as the two-finger rotation gesture. This callback will only occur if MapGesture is set to exclusive mode from MapGesture.setRotateEnabled(boolean)
        Specified by:
        onRotateLocked in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        See Also:
        MapGesture.setRotateEnabled(boolean)
        Override:

      • onRotateEvent

        public boolean onRotateEvent(float rotateAngle)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has performed a rotate gesture on a map.
        Specified by:
        onRotateEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        rotateAngle - An angle, in degrees, of the user interaction gesture since its last change
        Returns:
        True if consumed (which prevents the default map rotate-to-here behavior), false otherwise
        Override:

      • onTiltEvent

        public boolean onTiltEvent(float angle)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has performed a two-finger-tilt gesture on a map.
        Specified by:
        onTiltEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        angle - An angle, in degrees between the range of the minimum and maximum angle inclusively, to which the map tilt will change. The minimum and maximum angle can be retrieved thru the calls Map.getMinTilt() and Map.getMaxTilt().
        Returns:
        True if consumed (which prevents the default map tilt-to-here behavior), false otherwise
        See Also:
        Map.getMaxTilt(), Map.getMinTilt()
        Override:

      • onLongPressEvent

        public boolean onLongPressEvent(android.graphics.PointF p)
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has performed a long-press gesture on a map.

        If a MapMarker with dragging enabled is located at the same location, returning true for this method will nullify that setting.

        Specified by:
        onLongPressEvent in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Parameters:
        p - A PointF representing the on-screen point where a user has long-pressed
        Returns:
        True if consumed (which prevents the default map move-to-here behavior), false otherwise
        See Also:
        MapMarker.setDraggable(boolean)
        Override:

        Returns:

        Override:

      • onLongPressRelease

        public void onLongPressRelease()
        Description copied from interface: MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        A callback indicating that a user has released a long-press gesture on a map.

        This callback may also occur when the user has panned around the map.

        Specified by:
        onLongPressRelease in interface MapGesture.OnGestureListener
        Override:
